meanings.definition: The ability or power to conduct or transmit heat, electricity, or sound.
meanings.sent1: The metal's high conductivity allowed electricity to flow easily through it.
meanings.sent2: Copper is known for its excellent conductivity of both heat and electricity.
meanings.sent3: The rubber band boasted about its conductivity, claiming it could transmit sound better than any other material.
meanings.sent4: Her enthusiasm had a conductivity that spread through the room like an electric current.
meanings.sent5: The conductivity of the metal was so impressive that it could warm up quickly when placed on a stove.

meanings.definition: The degree to which a substance conducts electricity, calculated as the reciprocal of the resistance.
meanings.sent1: The conductivity of the wire was measured to determine its efficiency in transmitting electricity.
meanings.sent2: Scientists use conductivity to understand how well a material can conduct electricity.
meanings.sent3: The conductivity of the rubber duck in the bathtub was so high that it lit up like a light bulb.
meanings.sent4: The student's understanding had a conductivity that allowed the knowledge to flow effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The conductivity of the circuit was so low that the light bulb remained dim despite the power source.
